reviews.text:
You can not imagine that a small door next to the waffle shop leads to an alley ending up in a giant beer hall!

We made a quick pitstop for a beer. I must say the beer "Lambic" was great. I got to know about it from my Belgian friends and the history of this beer hall that serves this beer. It has a sweet bitter flavor that is perfectly balanced.

You must try it if you are in the vicinity as this is the only place that serves this beer. It goes without saying that they serve all other kinds of beer as well.You can not imagine that a small door next to the waffle shop leads to an alley ending up in a giant beer hall! üò±üç∫

You must try it if you are in the vicinity as this is the only place that serves this beer. It goes without saying that they serve all other kinds of beer as well. üìçüç∫ #beerlover #lambic #hiddengem

This place was a bit odd. It was very quiet in the later hours when I went with a few small groups enjoying a drink. That changed when an obnoxious group of Brits/Scots came in quite drunk. Workers didn‚Äôt seem too happy about it. Anyway, I had a jug of sweet lambic and I wasn‚Äôt a fan. It was enjoyable but the dry and funky lambics are my preferred version of the style. Workers weren‚Äôt super friendly, seemed rather bored. Interior was unique, place was down a narrow alley, maybe I visited at the wrong time. I would suggest you go to form your own opinion!

Stumbled across this place while exploring the city. It's tucked away between a hemp shop and a waffle shop down a narrow alley. Really feels like you've been transported back in time. The bar is really small so fills up quickly.

We tried the malange beers, really fruit and delicious especially if you are nursing a hangover. You get 2 jugs and whatever flavour you choose and mix them in your glass. This sounds terrible but it was a real pallette cleanser after drinking Belgian beers.

I hate the term but it's a hidden gem and probably my most favorite find during my visit.

You need to go with the intention and looking for the magnificent sign showing that you have arrived. Friendly service, nice menu that even includes beer flights- rare in this type of historical pub. Tables are organized neatly for rush hour, so, arrive before the peak time and enjoy your visit.
Good beers, good atmosphere, not too loud. Nice hidden place with a place to sit even on a busy evening. Beers are a bit more expensive than other places tho
